intro: Schizoglossum excisum, commonly known as the cut-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, deeply lobed leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Schizoglossum excisum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species in its native habitat.
